messages.text: I wasn’t sure if there was a way to setup the dockerfile/docker-compose to get different behaviour for different environments
Cool
Ok, that makes sense
which is good for staging/prod
uwsgi doesn’t seem to have that behaviour
Ah I see
because that actively watches the python files and updates when I change them
What's the different between running manage.py and calling uwsgi directly?
Ideal for dev (only dev) it would run /app/eighti/manage.py runserver 0.0.0.0:8080
I’m not sure about the differences between running the docker image for dev vs for staging
Hey
<https://us-west-2.console.aws.amazon.com/ec2/v2/home?region=us-west-2#Parameters:sort=Name>
Alright cool
Yup
Hey, not sure I completely understand how you PR works, is it using buildkite to build the docker container and then build and deploy it only for the branches which start with a v*?
Cool
Just sent an invite now
Is it something I need to be invited too?
I’m not sure if I have an account for that
(currently has no logs)
Logs for that cluster will end up here: <https://papertrailapp.com/groups/6780962/events>
Correct
paper trail would be our logging service right?
Cool
That is correct. The RDS instance is created separately, manually
is that separate?
I don’t see anything about an RDS instance
So from what I can tell that will create an amazon cloud with 1-3 ec2 instances and a bastion box
Cool yea, I’m sure I’ll have a few questions
Then you just deploy tasks on top of it
Please feel free to ask any questions. This PR basically uses the building block modules we created a few months back to set up a private network and Docker cluster
awesome
Gonna assign you a PR to review of the ECS cluster for <http://8i.com|8i.com> and dev portal, so you can see what I'm doing

This document outlines how to go about setting things up (don't worry if you don't understand it now, I'll walk through it with you when we come to that bridge) <https://eighteye.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/SRE/pages/1671180/ECS>
I'll come down and explain a bit more
alright, I don’t actually know what that is though :slightly_smiling_face:
So on the topic of setting up infrastructure for running <http://8i.com|8i.com> and dev portal, we'll probably roll the same setup as we did for studio, content platform, etc.
Coming down
thanks.
sweet
Ok, five minutes
anytime is good for me
Sure. When's good?
Hey, do you think you’d have some time to have a chat at some point today or tomorrow?
Oh awesome
I updated the BuildKite page with steps to fix this: <https://eighteye.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/SRE/pages/1572865/BuildKite>
Cool, I’ll sync with dave once he’s in and let you know if we need you again :slightly_smiling_face:
I have no idea where buildkite stuff happens, but I’m pretty happy with that :wink:
For now, yes
Sweet, is that something we will need to get you to do if it comes up again?
I basically logged into the box and did `sudo git clean -fxdq` inside the `/var/lib/buildkite-agent/builds/build-agent/8i/holo-dot-8i-dot-com` folder

ah yea, I think we have hit similar problems before. Is there an easy way to get out of that state? I’m not sure how much more work dave has to go on his change. He is in late today but will check with him when he gets in.
And `git clean` runs as `buildkite-agent` user
Yeah, the `__pycache__` folder had root:root permissions
And actually the first failure for holo-api looks like it was on dave’s branch where he is doing some docker stuff
Ok
It looks like it was the same, <https://buildkite.com/organizations/8i/agents/f76820e8-96a2-4a91-b1d5-63c0048f1b7d>
Its happened on multiple branches, I’m not which agents they used, but could of been the same one.
Is this happening on multiple agents?
Thanks
I don’t believe anything has changed from our side
Hey, let's have a look

Hey, we seem to be getting some problems with buildkite. git clean is not working. 
<https://buildkite.com/8i/holo-dot-8i-dot-com/builds/2629#b87a7da3-cd58-408e-a73e-dfba23763c8f>
Yea I saw, Champion.
Issue resolved. Your build is green
Awesome, thanks.
Hey, had a look at it now, let me see

Hey I’m getting a buildkite error.
ERROR: Service ‘app’ failed to build: error creating aufs mount to /var/lib/docker/aufs/mnt/ee8e3f989cbfcc67583524449db419f1aa386cae50dd281099ba170ac44c9c84-init: invalid argument
<https://buildkite.com/8i/holo-dot-8i-dot-com/builds/2574#31ec4fe9-1552-46e9-9607-7b300681f1d3>
Cool
Until we get more info on why it's doing that
We'll keep a closer eye on the agents for now
mmm, ok, yea I’m out of my depth when it comes to how buildkite does its thing :slightly_smiling_face:
Thats about the only thing I can think of which would make that branch unique in anyway
Because I fixed it with a `git fetch`
Still, feels like BK is not checking origin properly
Hmm maybe
Thats probably something which happens in that branch, but not with the others as much
I wonder if its something to do with using the github “Merge Pull Request” to merge into that branch
cool
I have added my voice to that GH issue, and a retry fixed it for us
oh yea, I thought that might be the case
BuildKite pulls whatever ref is on the webhook
Is it possible to configure buildkite to always pull from the git HEAD?
so yea
Its our default branch
Is this the most actively used one?
hmm, strange that it only happens on the develop branch though
Looks like we may be hitting this: <https://github.com/buildkite/agent/issues/477>

attachments.title: Retry/sleep Git checkouts · Issue #477 · buildkite/agent
attachments.text: Sometimes GitHub web hooks sender faster than the time it takes for their Git servers to update. So builds end up starting before the commit exists. This often surfaces as this error: $ git checkou...
attachments.fallback: GitHub: Retry/sleep Git checkouts · Issue #477 · buildkite/agent

messages.text: Strange. Let me take a look
Hmm, that “reference is not a tree: be789751bbebcbf032a2af052525af11750c4a93” has come back. <https://buildkite.com/8i/holo-dot-8i-dot-com/builds/2524#35b691f9-6357-4b97-aabe-bad6d2ecc456>
Yeah, that'd be great :thumbsup_all:

Hey, I’m going to update the settings of our runscope a little bit, try and avoid those alerts for a single 504 like we were getting over the weekend. 
Adding immediate re-run after a failure and alerts will only fire after 2 fails instead of 1.
Oh yup, cool. Thanks, and I’ll let you know if I see it again.
I have found a few mentions of this bug in BuildKite's GitHub repo but they claimed it was fixed

The thing I've done in the past is to log into the buildkite agent and run `git reset --hard HEAD` inside the build folder. Have just done it on two of the build nodes. Can you let me know if your builds fail again?
Alright, let me have a looksie
but not sure about dave, who is away now for a week
I haven’t done that before
Does the team regularly push with `--force`?
Yup, seen this before. Seems to happen more often than not in that repo

Yo, if you have some spare time today (no rush) would you mind looking into a funny buildkite error for me.
<https://buildkite.com/8i/holo-dot-8i-dot-com/builds?branch=develop>
This branch, and only this branch is failing to find the right git commit “fatal: reference is not a tree: a62077ee09d7f438fc33ff46e2a07876d5cdff7a”
Yea cool, thanks for taking a look.
Maybe it was a transient issue, so please let me know if it re-occurs
I re-ran it and it seems to have worked: <https://buildkite.com/8i/holo-dot-8i-dot-com/builds/2407>

Its running this script AFAIK <https://github.com/8i/holo-api/blob/develop/.buildkite/deploy-backend/run_deploy.sh>
I’m not familiar with that script, but it looks like it does have a few custom exit calls in it.
Yeah, it's the final step indeed. Will investigate
Cheers for that. It looks like it may have gotten most of the way there. So if there is any manual steps I can perform to get me through tomorrow that is fine too.
Ok, will have to take this as homework and investigate a bit. Will let you know tonight/tomorrow
Good to know :slightly_smiling_face:
Always try again before I bother someone :slightly_smiling_face:
Yea its happened twice for me
Have you re-triggered it?
oh right
I wasn’t planning for prod today.
I'm gonna be out of office all of tomorrow
It is, but its just for staging
Is this blocking your deployment?
Exit code 255 is strange
Thanks
Let me have a look
That's a new one

Another buildkite failure for you to take a look at when you can. 
The final deploy step appears to be timing out (10 minutes) before it completes. I don’t believe it used to get close to that timeout. 
<https://buildkite.com/8i/holo-dot-8i-dot-com/builds/2405#_>
Cool, thanks
No worries. Let me know if that doesn't fix it
oh right, hadn’t checked that :slightly_smiling_face:
Your build's failure looks exactly like what I found on other pipelines. The blurb above is the fix

attachments.text:
<!here|@here> if you use the `docker-compose` plugin on BuildKite, make sure you're pinning the plugin version. So where you see:
```
...
    plugins:
      docker-compose:
...
```
Change it to:
```
...
    plugins:
      docker-compose#v1.4.0:
...
```
attachments.fallback:
[July 25th, 2017 8:55 PM] raf: <!here|@here> if you use the `docker-compose` plugin on BuildKite, make sure you're pinning the plugin version. So where you see:
```
...
    plugins:
      docker-compose:
...
```
Change it to:
```
...
    plugins:
      docker-compose#v1.4.0:
...
```
